name: iniquitously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is very wrong and unfair: They iniquitously changed the rules at the last minute in order to exclude her from competing. No king should treat his subjects so iniquitously that they choose to rebel.
More examplesFewer examplesHis brother's plotting iniquitously denied him his rightful place as the head of the family business.The ordinary people were treated iniquitously by the ruling classes.The scholarships that allowed bright children from poorer homes to go to university have now been iniquitously abolished.
